intro: Arrabidaea triplinervia, commonly known as the African violet or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually purple or violet, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. The leaves are palmately lobed, with a rough, hairy texture that helps it thrive in dry conditions.
